titleproper.value: Receipts for Sale of Property for Unpaid Assessments<lb/>1843-1853<lb/> <num>AHMC - New York City Street Commissioner</num>

unittitle.value: Receipts for sale of property for unpaid assessments

abstract.value:
Two receipts issued by the Street Commissioner's Office of New York City for property sold at public auction in satisfaction of unpaid assessments. A receipt dated June 26, 1843, is for the address 131 Forty-second Street, owned by O. Holmes and R. Stebbins, and sold to George A. Hoyt; subsequent assignments recorded on the back of the certificate are dated 1845 and 1848. A second receipt dated April 22, 1853, is for the address 16 Sixteenth Street, owned by Martin Hill, and sold to the Corporation of New York; a subsequent assignment in 1853 is recorded on the back of the certificate.<lb/> <lb/>

To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: <extref actuate="onRequest" href="http://bobcat.library.nyu.edu/primo-explore/fulldisplay?docid=nyu_aleph007345445&context=L&vid=NYHS&search_scope=nyhs&tab=nyhs&lang=en_US">Receipts for sale of property for unpaid assessments</extref>
